fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44935].
  {panel}

Since Cloud's last release, it's no longer possible to switch the project navigation back to the old default as per: [Configuring Project Navigation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Configuring+Project+Navigation]

*Partial Workaround*

If your interested in the statistics in the 'overview' page, you can use the 'issue statistics gadget' to view them. This won't require a filter and will look very similar to the old view and won't require a filter to be created.

To do that:
# Create a dashboard to show the statistics
# Add the [Issue Statistics gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Issue+Statistics+Gadget] to it (one for each project and statistics)
# Select the project from which you want to see these statistics
# Select in 'Statistic Type' the field you want to see (for example, statistics that were shown in the 'overview' page include: 'priority', 'assignee', 'status' and 'component')
fields.summary: No longer possible to switch the project navigation.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Anonymous users are able to search for users from the issue navigator. 
* Only when the Anonymous users types the full username.
* Browse users permission has been restricted to but this does not prevent anonymous users to find JIRA users by typing their full username.
* There might be a security concern as such :
{quote}
A cracker would use automated trials using a list of common (user) names, find some hundreds of them (easily, including the first issue with those public filters), there needs just be one weak password and he's in.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure browse permissions for a project to "Anyone"
# Create a user name for example John
# Access JIRA's issue navigator without logging in ( As anonymous user). {{/issues/?jql=}}
# Type John on the Assignee Field

h3. Expected Results
# Should not display/confirm that the user exists

h3. Actual Results
# Auto-complete/Suggestion appears that the username John exist.
fields.summary: Anonymous users able to search for JIRA users from issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44931].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Update as of 17 September July 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,
We shipped some improvements in how attachments can be added this week and here's the new pieces we added:
* Drag and drop functionality: Grab files from anywhere and drop them to an issue.
* Copy and paste: You can now paste files directly to an issue too.

As part of this, we decided to remove the Attach Screenshot option to simplify the menu. But the functionality remains unchanged, i.e. you can still take screenshots with the same keyboard and then just paste on to the issue. You will get the same dialog where you can rename the screenshot.
Thanks for letting us know your thoughts as always!
Cheers,
Lingbo
{panel}

We have noticed today, that Attach Screenshot has disappeared from Issue menu for all projects. 

Plus,  I can't find 'View Issue Ops Bar Attach Screenshot Link(attach-screenshot)' module under Administrator >> Manage My Plugins >> System Plugins >>'Issue Operations Plugin' 

Is this a known issue?
fields.summary: 'Attach Screenshot' has disappeared from menu of the issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA doesn't respect the ASSIGNABLE permission while moving issue. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.10
* JIRA 6.3.15

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable *Allow unassigned issues*
# Create two projects: project A and project B
# Set the default assignee to *Project lead* in project B
# Emptied the ASSIGNABLE permission in project B
# Create issue in project A 
# Move issue to project B

h3. Expected Results

Issue move should fail with "The default assignee does NOT have ASSIGNABLE permission OR Unassigned issues are turned off."

h3. Actual Results

The issues is moved and still assigned to the current assignee

h3.Workaround

Ensure the default assignee has the ASSIGNABLE permission
fields.summary: JIRA doesnt respect the ASSIGNABLE permission while moving issue
Add ability "send email" when creating user via the REST API

fields.description:
h4. Summary
earliestUnreleasedVersion() seems to apply globally across all projects.

If I pass in a project I would expect that the earliestUnreleasedVersion for the project is returned, instead it returns the global earliestUnreleasedVersion() filtered by the project.  This means that I get no results if another project is releasing a version before mine.

This is not useful when creating filters for multiple projects with multiple release dates and release versions.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
1) Create ProjectA with a fixVersion of "A" set for release tomorrow
2) Create ProjectB with a fixVersion of "B" set for release next week
3) Use advanced search with the query "fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion(ProjectB)"
4) No Results are returned

h4. Expected
Issues with a fixVersion of "B" are returned
fields.summary: earliestUnreleasedVersion() not working as expected

fields.description:
h6. BACKGROUND:
-  Impacts IE version 8 and newer. Reproduced in IE11  
- JIRA 6.2.1 is unaffected
- Reproduced using JIRA 6.4.5 and 7.0.0

h6. Steps to reproduce:
1. Attach a .msg file in an issue
2. Double click on the attachment file
3. A pop up will appear at the bottom part of an issue

In JIRA 6.2.1, there's an option to "Open" the file which will redirect you to Microsoft Outlook. However, in JIRA 6.4.5, the option to open the file is missing, thus, only allows you to "Save" and "Cancel. In this way, you need to download the file first before you can view it in Outlook. 

h6. Expected result
You should be able to open the .msg file without downloading it in JIRA 6.4.5

h6. Actual result:
There is no option to open the file in JIRA 6.4.5

h6. Workaround
The workaround in the following KB article describes a way to unset the header that is preventing the Open button from appearing.
* [No "Open" button in Internet Explorer When Clicking on Attachments | https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=311920262] 
* This workaround will work for JIRA as well as Confluence
fields.summary: Option to "Open" a file with .msg format was missing in JIRA 6.4.x using Internet Explorer

fields.description:
h3. Summary
DBPC configuration {{pool-prepared-statements}} set to true leads to Statement Leak, In case of Oracle DB it will be 'ORA-01000: maximum open cursors exceeded'


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure {{pool-prepared-statements}} to true
# Wait

h3. Expected Results
No pool exception. 

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
...
java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01000: maximum open cursors exceeded
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.find(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:179)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.DelegatingActiveObjects.find(DelegatingActiveObjects.java:93)  <+2> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:39)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
DBCP bug: [DBCP-372|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DBCP-372], fixed in 1.5/2.x, JIRA uses 1.3/1.4
Note from: https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-dbcp/configuration.html
NOTE - Make sure your connection has some resources left for the other statements. Pooling PreparedStatements may keep their cursors open in the database, causing a connection to run out of cursors, especially if maxOpenPreparedStatements is left at the default (unlimited) and an application opens a large number of different PreparedStatements per connection. To avoid this problem, maxOpenPreparedStatements should be set to a value less than the maximum number of cursors that can be open on a Connection.

h3.Workaround
Remove {{pool-prepared-statements}} option (set to false)
fields.summary: DBPC configuration pool-prepared-statements leads to Statement Leak

h2. Problem Definition
* The *'Configure Fields'* button which exist in the 'Create Issue Pop Up Screen' is not available in the 'Create Issue Screen that is access by URL'. This seems to be a missing functionality at the moment, and are not configurable at the moment.
* Inconsistency of configuration as if through Create Issue Screen Popup, user have configured custom-fields-visibility, when access the create issue screen from a URL link will remove this custom-fields-visibility setup
* To access the URL : https://<your jira URL>/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=1234&issuetype=6 , change PID with appropriate project ID and issue type.
!URL_access_createissue_popup1.png|thumbnail!
!URL_access_createissue_popup.png|thumbnail!
!URL_access_createissue.png|thumbnail!


h2. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44890].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The idea behind it is that for large enterprise with many different types of projects and workflows, I would like to avoid long lists of roles on the project administration page many of which are irrelevant for the project. The business reason behind this request is to better support large enterprise -wide Jira instances with many projects of different characteristics and workflows.

h3. Suggested Solution
Roles can be checked as 'global' to be visible in all projects, or unchecked as 'global' to be visible only in projects associated with schemes that use the role.

Detailed steps:
When adding or editing a Project role,
!1_1.png|thumbnail!
it should be possible to mark a role as ‘Global’ or not. When ‘Global’ is checked, the current Jira behavior is used: the role is listed on the Administration > Roles page of all projects on the Jira instance
!2_2.png|thumbnail!
When ’Global’ is unchecked, the role is listed only on the Administration > Roles page of projects associated with the schemes that use the role, as viewable by the ‘ View Usage’ function.
!3_3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: I want Roles specific to projects associated with the schemes where the role is used

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Constant exceptions in logs due to an extra slash in the URL.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA and JIRA Agile;
# Tail the localhost logs;
# Access JIRA with an extra forward slash in the end of the URL:
{panel}
http://localhost:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa/
{panel}

h3. Expected Results
It should work without any errors in the logs.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{$JIRA_INSTALL/logs/localhost-*.log}} file:
{noformat}
Aug 20, 2015 12:15:48 PM org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationContext log
SEVERE: Unhandled exception occurred whilst decorating page
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -6
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1955)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Enable the [Access Log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/User+access+logging] and look for the IP address accessing JIRA with the incorrect URL by comparing the date and time from the exception in the _$JIRA_INSTALL/logs/localhost-*.log_ file.
fields.summary: Constant exceptions in logs due to an extra slash in the URL

  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition
* Issue commented event are unable to be fired if commented in a transition screen.
* If comment field exist in a transition screen, only the transition event will be fired, and user will only receive the transition notification, leaving out the issue was commented during the transition.
* This is because it can't fire an event that tells listeners: "this issue has been modified, it includes a change on the assignee, a change in the priority, and also a new comment". 

h2. Suggested Solution
* To enable JIRA to have an event that trigger all the necessary event that happens during a transition.
fields.summary: Issue commented event are unable to be fired if commented in a transition screen

Hi there!

We are working to install a SSO solution at a customer's instance. Everything works fine, except when wanting to *close an issue* from the new Project Navigation view. Then it fails.

After analysing the problem in detail, we have detected that when closing an issue from this new view, JIRA is *always* returning a "401 Unauthorized" error (see Developer Tools section in the attached screenshots).  All other actions (ie. resolve issue) return a "200 OK".

Steps to reproduce this behavior:

fields.description:
There are several types of cron expression errors that Quartz fails to recognize as such, and sometimes this can result in the job not being scheduled or running at unexpected times.  A few examples discovered in JIRA Cloud include:

* {{0 0/150 * * * ? *}} -- {{/150}} is out of range.  If the expression had been specified using {{\*/150}}, which on the surface would mean the same thing, then Quartz would report the error.  Instead, with a starting value of 0 explicitly given, Quartz silently ignores the invalid interval.
* {{0 40 9 1W,15W 1-12 ? 2010-2050}} -- Multiple values are not supported for the {{W}} flag.  When you list multiple values, the {{W}} flag state on the first value wins.  If the first value specifies it, then the other values are silently ignored.  If it does not, then the {{W}} flag is silently ignored for the other values.

Clearly the intent of the first cron expression is to run a job every 2 1/2 hours, but it actually isn't possible to express that using a cron expression, and since the invalid interval gets ignored, the job actually runs every hour.  The intent of the second one is to run on the weekdays closest to the 1st and 15th of the month, but only the 1st of the month is actually honoured.

JIRA should either reject these expressions or honour their spirit.  It should not silently accept them as if they are valid but then do something else.
fields.summary: Some invalid cron expressions are accepted, sometimes with unexpected results

If you create a pie chart from a project in JIRA then the project name appears in the title, however if you create it from a saved filter it shows JQL query in the chart title instead of the name.  This makes it difficult to differentiate between charts.

{panel}

{panel}
Use the {{jira-gadgets-plugin-6.4.9.jar}} file (available in a 6.4.9 version of the JIRA installation zip) to replace the 6.4.10/6.4.11 gadgets JAR file in {{$JIRA_INSTALL_DIR/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/}} folder.

h3. Problem Definition
When using JIRA's built-in reports, only Project Pivot Report has the ability to choose from "additional fields", a custom field that is a text field (single line).

For example, in the Pie Chart Report, we are limited to a certain type of field under Statistic Type. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42249. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Are there plans to expand the built-in reports to include more reports that have the opportunity to use a custom text field?

In our work flow, we create fill-in forms in SharePoint that passes the field’s information through to JIRA. The SharePoint field is a drop down selection, control in SharePoint. It passes the text through to a JIRA text Field (single line).

We would like to include custom fields of all types in reporting options. Project Pivot Report is the only report we can find that does this. We know that we can create a filter and export to excel. To the average user, the built-in reports are very handy and visually pleasing to use. We also know that these fields will limitations, depending upon how the field is used in a report and what’s in the field.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Cloud admin, I want the ability to choose additional fields for all reports

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Customers need the following plugin install to make their tasks easier:

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.wittified.jira.project-creator
fields.summary: Bundle the The Project Creator For Jira Plugin in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44817].
  {panel}

Dave Meyer asked us to file the following suggestion regarding a new feature that was added to JIRA 7 EAP:

In the list of JIRA 7 EAP [platform changes|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/latest-updates/preparing-for-jira-7-0/jira-7-0-platform-changes], the docs suggest that we will need to use a new BundleContext class in JIRA 7 onward.

I have a question and a suggestion:

a) Is this change already published in JIRA 7.0.0-m01b? Our add-on is seemingly working on that version of JIRA without making any changes (and using the old BundleContext).

b) Is there any way that JIRA 7 could continue to ship an shim interface corresponding to the old BundleContext (org.osgi.framework.BundleContext), and have that shimmed interface simply extend the new Eclipse BundleContext? It seems like this would permit add-ons to continue to list the old interface without any further difficulties.

This otherwise presents a significant binary compatibility problem for add-ons between JIRA 6 and 7. The current method used to get a BundleContext requires us to mark our own classes as implementors of the above interface…but if we list the new class in our JAR, it won’t load on JIRA 6 because the class doesn’t exist. If we continue to list the old class, but JIRA 7 removes it, then our JAR won’t load in JIRA 7. Although I haven’t thought through all of the classloader specifics, I think the above solution would make this very easy on everybody.

We’ve been able to resolve most issues like this through reflection, but we don’t have that option here because it’s related to the class inheritance, and it happens before our add-on gets control. Is there anything you can do?
fields.summary: Make JIRA 7 BundleContext backwards-compatible
Permit add-ons to suppress "Dangerous use of multiple connections" warnings in ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor

h3. Problem Definition
The 'delete' application link in the Application Link management screen is poor. The X that is used to delete applications is not clearly in it's own column, so it looks like it's related to the Action it shares a column with.
For example, in the attached screenshot, the X looks associated with the Edit action for crucible-dev 1 and with the Make Primary action for crucible-prv1-preview.
!ApplinkManagement.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the UI.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44814].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary 

Attempting to restore a backup from JIRA Cloud (latest version: 7.0.0-OD-01-193) to JIRA 6.4.8 or 6.4.10 always throws the following error.
{quote}The file you are trying to import is from JIRA 7.0.0-OD-01-193, which is newer than your current version of JIRA and will not work. The import file claims it can be successfully imported into JIRA 6.4.8 or later.

If JIRA 6.4.8 is not yet available for download, please contact support.{quote}.

*Resolution*
This was a data problem, and the data has been fixed for all existing customers.

If you had previously hit this problem, please do a new export and import from that new file.

*Exception*
If you have created a new Cloud instance in the last few days, then you may still hit this error when migrating from Cloud to Server.
If this effects you then raise a support ticket and let our support team help you out.
That is, new instances created betweend
fields.summary: Can't Restore JIRA Cloud Backup on JIRA Server

h3. Summary
Editing any Sub-Tasks would replace the Description Field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Sub-Task administration (/secure/admin/subtasks/ManageSubTasks.jspa)
# Use Edit operation (secure/admin/subtasks/EditSubTaskIssueTypes!default.jspa)
# Check the {{Description}} field.

h3. Expected Results
The Description field should be maintained to the value it was before the *edit* button was clicked.

h3. Actual Results
The Description field is replaced automatically by JIRA with the name of the sub-task
 
h3. Notes
Tested in FF 39, Chrome 44

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44809].
  {panel}

When exporting a set of issues as a Workload Pie Chart and there is no work logged for the issues in the set, an error message is shown that has a typo. The attached image shows the message.

It says "It seems there no work logged for these issues. I can only generate this report if there is work logged."

It should say "It seems there {color:red}*is*{color} no work logged for these issues. I can only generate this report if there is work logged."

To reproduce:
# Filter for a set of JIRA issues in which no work is logged
# Click Export->Charts
# Scroll down to "Workload Pie Chart"
# Click on "Workload Pie Chart"
# Observe the incorrect text.
fields.summary: Typo in Workload Pie Chart message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44803].
  {panel}

When Jira sees a Git commit with a string matching a known issue, it correctly highlights those commits in the development section on the appropriate ticket (see first attachment).

When the Activity stream renders those commits, however, it doesn't link to the ticket if the ticket reference isn't the very first string in the commit message (see second attachment).

It would be *fantastic* to get all ticket references converted to links in the activity stream.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Activity stream doesn't link to issues from commits consistently

{noformat}

h3. Expected behavior:
The link should have been created with no error message and the link to the Confluence page should point to the Display URL defined at the application link configuration.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Install JIRA and Confluence (with any proxy or ssl integraton);
# Set the Base URL for both applications;
# Create the application link using the URL defined as the Base URL;
# After creating the application link, edit the _Display URL_ of Confluence to a different URL pointing to the same server (i.e.: Server IP), as in the following example:
!applink.png|thumbnail!
# Create the link to a Confluence page.

h3. Workaround:
Use the [link to web page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues#LinkingIssues-CreatingalinktoanywebpageURL] functionality, instead of the [link to Confluence page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues#LinkingIssues-CreatingalinktoaConfluencepage].
{quote}

h4. WORKAROUND:
Use the full link, not the tiny link. Or use Web Link option
fields.summary: INCOMPLETE - Link to Confluence page does not work when Display URL is different than Application URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44795].
  {panel}

Hi, 
Our customers loves Jira but often their mailbox is the main todo-list during the day. This is of course sad to say but until we have covered ALL business processes at the customers site this will continue to be the reality for many users.   

As such I would like to suggest a function to unwatch a ticket without having to click on issue link and logging into Jira. 

A link, a button, a reply in the notification...I probably don't have the best idea on the HOW but I know that the function would be appreciated.
fields.summary: Unwatch Issue through replying on notification
No 6.x and 7.x compatibility for searchService
All categories listed in JQL suggestions
Let me choose the default view of a project
Auto-update issue list
Preview for comments, etc.

h4. +Note+

If JIRA and Confluence run over HTTP, the same Page (with special characters in its title) can be linked without problem.

(!) This may have been superseded by JRASERVER-42880.
h4. +Workaround+
 * Temporarily remove the Special Character from the Page Title before linking, then edit the Page Title to add it back
 * Use JIRA Macros to mention the JIRA Issue in the Confluence Page
 * Use the page link that contains its page ID instead (manually):
 ** Get the link by clicking Options (...) -> Page Information -> change the URL from _...viewinfo.action..._ to _...viewpage.action..._
fields.summary: NPE linking to Confluence Page with a Comma, Colon, or Parenthesis in Page Title over SSL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44783].
  {panel}

h4. Description
When SSO is enabled, user details are not logged on JIRA. 
This is possible to work-around upon enabling User access logging settings to get this information out of JIRA and then search on these results on the logs, however it is not something achievable via the user interface.

h4 Suggestion 
Log user details and show through the web interface, as any other internal directory user.
fields.summary: Log user access details when SSO is configured on JIRA

* Java7

# Create a project with several issues
# Attempt to attach the affected image to an issue
#* After attaching an image to a JIRA issue, the image doesn't seem to be successfully attached. It will just be stuck in the following screenshot

# Click *Cancel* or refresh the page

# The image is attached without any problems
# Refreshing the page will load the issue as per normal

 h3. Notes
# Seems to be related to Java version
#* After updating Java to version 8, the issue can be viewed but the thumbnail is still not generated
# Problem does *not* happen with JIRA 6.3.15 (Java7)
# Since JIRA 6.4 supports both Java 7 & 8, JIRA shouldn't be affected by this when Java 7 is used

h3.Workaround
# Manually generate the thumbnail for this image (instructions found [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+View+Issue+in+JIRA+after+Attaching+a+PNG+File]); OR
# Upgrade your JAVA version to 1.8.0_05 and above

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44778].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition
* In the Map Fields screen of the CSV import wizard, the fields are being shown as localized field names. This can cause confusion because the localized names are ambiguous, i.e. the localization can apply to more than one field.

h3. Suggested Solution
* To have an option for user to be able to show the fields, "Display Field Names in Localized Fashion" or "Display Raw Field Names" or something to that effect.
fields.summary: Fields in Map Fields Screen of CSV Import Wizard is showing localized field name

fields.description:
The pie chart shows redundant entries in the case that a custom field has more than one custom field context. In the attached screenshot you see a pie chart with statistic type on a single select list custom field. The select list entries are the same in the different contexts. The difference is in default values of single JIRA projects.

By clicking on one of the circle segments with the same name you get the sum of all issues that meet the filter criteria. This is as expected. But it is also expected that you have only one segment of the circle per name.
fields.summary: Redundant entries in pie chart
Make ordering for tab in issue detail based on user preference
